resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
andygrove commented on pull request #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587
 
 
   This PR builds on https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5586 and adds `sccache` and builds many of the project dependencies in the base image to avoid downloading and compiling them each time the project builds in CI.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on issue #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587#issuecomment-539792216
 
 
   I'm testing this.
   Could you show how to confirm whether cache is used or not?

andygrove commented on issue #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587#issuecomment-539816865
 
 
   Thanks @kou  ... my advice would be to run `docker-compose build rust` then `docker-compose run rust` before and after this PR and count how many crates get *downloaded* (not compiled). You should see a significant reduction after this PR.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

andygrove commented on issue #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587#issuecomment-539816865
 
 
   Thanks @kou  ... my advice would be to run `docker-compose build rust` then `docker-compose run rust` before and after this PR and count how many crates get **downloaded** (not compiled) during the **run** step. You should see a significant reduction after this PR.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587#issuecomment-540322891
 
 
   Thanks.
   Without this change https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/02d1e9736808d9a9624bef5577c880d8c165e853 takes 14m 44s https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/252662504
   With this change takes 22m 46s https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587/checks?check_run_id=253006461
   It seems that this is slower on GitHub Actions.

andygrove commented on issue #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5587#issuecomment-541454099
 
 
   @kou Are you stating timing just for "run" or for "build" and "run" ? Overall this will take longer, but the "run" part should have been faster. This is only useful if the build step gets cached.

   > Are you stating timing just for "run" or for "build" and "run" ?
   
   For GitHub Actions: "build" and "run".
   
   For local confirmation: just "run".

nevi-me commented on pull request #5587: ARROW-6798: [CI] [Rust] Build image contains cached dependencies
